docs.snippet: MIAMI, Feb. 28 (AP)--A Field of 13 was entered today for tomorrow's 25th running of Hialeah's $50,000 added Black Helen Handicap, making this the richest edition of the feature for fillies and mares, at 1 1/8 miles.

headline.main: RICH FLORIDA RACE DRAWS FIELD OF 13; Straight Deal Is Favored in the Black Helen Today

docs.snippet: The meeting of the hemispheric foreign ministers in Buenos Aires was a success--on paper. This was all that could reasonably be asked of it.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1--The smallest nation in South America inaugurated Oscar Diego Gestido, a retired air force general, today for a five-year term as President.

headline.main: Gestido Is Inaugurated as President of Uruguay

docs.snippet: SAN SALVADOR, March 2 President Julio Adalberto Rivera of El Salvador threatened today to boycott the projected meeting of American presidents if the international coffee agreement was not revised beforehand.

docs.snippet: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., March 3--Having fixed his policy course in two months of intense domestic and diplomatic activity, President Johnson retreated briefly to his ranch near here today to prepare for the year's second major round of activity.

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, March 4--The children in Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay go back to school on Monday and already the cheerful sights and sounds of summer are gone from this seaside resort.

docs.snippet: Officials active in United States intelligence operations have expressed the fear that some of their most effective weapons have been blunted by disclosures of the secret  financial support provided by the Central Intelligence Agency to other groups.
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials active in United States intelligence operations have expressed the fear that some of their most effective weapons have been blunted by disclosures of the secret financial support provided by the Central Intelligence Agency to other groups.
docs.abstract: US intelligence officials throughout world, citing unabated Communist challenge in subversion and influence seeking, fear effectiveness of US program has been blunted by disclosures of CIA aid to private groups, article based on ints by NY Times correspondents; stress that brunt of USSR worldwide intelligence drive is not in collecting data but in exerting influence; see misunderstanding in US about nature of conflict with Communism; stress main role of intelligence is to prevent Communist takeover; former Hungarian intelligence man who defected to West sees propaganda as prime weapon and deplores 'naive' Amer attitude toward it; Western officials note strategy of Communist intelligence services; estimate that 40% of USSR ambs now serving have had prior intelligence connections

headline.main: Blunting of C.I.A. Drive By Disclosures Is Feared; Blunting of Intelligence Weapons Feared Since Disclosure of C.I.A. Financing

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: CIA ROLE IN US COLLEGE GROUPS ACTIVITIES

docs.snippet: Reducing the voting age from 21 to 18 years in New York State would mean a nearly 8 per cent increase in the potential electorate, the Temporary State Commission on the Constitutional Convention reported yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Reducing the voting age from 21 to 18 years in New York State would mean a nearly 8 per cent increase in the potential electorate, the Temporary State Commission on the Constitutional Convention reported yesterday.
docs.abstract: temporary comm issues study of voting laws

headline.main: STATE UNIT MAKES VOTING AGE STUDY; Reduction to 18 Would Add 8% to Rolls, Report Says
